definition: to accomplish much/to have good prospects/to have a promising future
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: These things make a difference, can even make more of a difference.
sentences.chinese: 能大有作为，甚至不仅仅是作为。

sentences.english: The potential for China-EU cooperation in this area is huge.
sentences.chinese: 文化是中欧可以大有作为的合作领域。

sentences.english: It permitted individual entrepreneurs to do their own thing.
sentences.chinese: 这时私人企业便可以大有作为，不必束手束脚。

sentences.english: Geo-spatial information science and technology is one of the most emerging fields of the progress of science and technology.
sentences.chinese: 地球空间信息科学技术是大有作为的科技领域之一。

sentences.english: I think where it will be really useful is in education.
sentences.chinese: 我想它会在教育领域大有作为。

sentences.english: With your diligence, I'm sure you will amount to something in the future.
sentences.chinese: 依你的勤奋，我敢肯定你将来一定会大有作为。

sentences.english: Use your arrow keys to manoeuver the pieces.
sentences.chinese: 用你的箭头键可大有作为的作品。

sentences.english: I don't really see this card doing much.
sentences.chinese: 我并不认为这张牌将大有作为。

sentences.english: There are plenty of opportunities for young people here.
sentences.chinese: 青年人在这里是可以大有作为的。

definition: with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
to have boundless prospects
(idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
to have a future full of promise
opportunity/favorable circumstance/stroke of luck
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
to achieve or accomplish goals
in the future/future/the future/CL:個|个[ge4]
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
to showcase one's (unique) talents/to display one's (individual) prowess
visionary and sagacious (idiom)
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
to win success and recognition (idiom)
